org.aoplib4j.uml
Class CodeToDiagramWriter

java.lang.Object
  org.aoplib4j.uml.SequenceDiagramWriter
      org.aoplib4j.uml.DFSDiagramWriter
          org.aoplib4j.uml.CodeToDiagramWriter

public final class CodeToDiagramWriter
extends DFSDiagramWriter

Writer for the CODETODIAGRAM project. (http://www.assembla.com/wiki/show/codetodiagram). A CODETODIAGRAM sequence diagram is a xml file containing 2 sections :

  • the actors section 
      <actors>
   <actor id="user" type="user"> User</actor>
   <actor id="view" type="boundary">View</actor>
  </actors>
  • the messages section 
     <messages>
  <message type="call" from="user" to="view" text="request()"/>
  <message type="call" from="view" to="controller" text="handleEvnt()"/>
  <message type="return" from="view"  to="user"  text="notifyUser()"/>
 </messages>
It is possible to generate the uml diagram from the XML file using this url: http://www.thiagomata.com/codetodiagram/svn/public/caller.php

Author:
Adrian Citu

writeToMessageBuffer

private void writeToMessageBuffer(SequenceMethod meth,
                                  CodeToDiagramWriter.MessageType type)
Write a message to the messagesBuffer. If the message type is a call then the line will be: 
  <message type="call" 
      from="meth.getParent().getClassName()" 
      to="meth.getClassName()" 
      text="meth.getMethodName()"
  />
If the message type is a return then the to and from attributes are reversed: 
  <message type="return" 
      from="meth.getClassName()" 
      to="meth.getParent().getClassName()" 
      text="meth.getMethodName()"
  />

Parameters:
meth - the method for compute the message.
type - the message type
